detail_description: The Arulmigu Aadi Kumbeswarar Temple is a renowned Hindu temple located in the heart of Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu. It is considered the twenty-sixth Paadal Petra Sthalam in the Chola region south of River Cauvery. Constructed by the Chola dynasty in the 7th century, it is one of the oldest Shiva temples and gives the city its name.
name: Arulmigu Adi Kumbeswarar Temple,Kumbakonam
address: 14/21, Kumbeswarar N St, Valayapettai Agraharam, Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu 612001, India

detail_description: Maha Maham Tank, located in Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu, is a significant temple tank spanning 6.2 acres and encircled by 16 shrines. It boasts 21 submerged spring wells named after celestial deities and holy rivers of India. The tank hosts the 'Mahaa Maham' festival every 12 years, drawing millions of visitors for a sacred confluence of rivers.
name: Maha Maham Tank
address: Kanmani Devi Nagar, Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu 612001

excerpt: Elaborate Hindu temple complex dedicated to Vishnu with ornate, colorful carvings & festivals.
detail_description: Sri Sarangapani Swami Temple, located in Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu, is an ancient Hindu temple complex dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Situated on the banks of the River Kaveri, this sacred site attracts devotees from around the world. The temple is not only a place of worship but also a masterpiece of art with its intricately carved and colorful mythological sculptures and paintings.
name: Sri Aravamudhazhwan (Sarngapaniswami) Temple
address: X95G+R4X, Taluk, Valayapettai Agraharam, Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu 612001, India

detail_description: Arulmigu Chakrapani Swami Temple, located in Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu, is a prominent shrine dedicated to Lord Vishnu. The temple features a towering 12-tier gopuram rising up to 175 feet, showcasing exquisite architecture dating back to the Vijayanagar and Medieval Chola periods. This ancient holy place of worship is renowned for its ornate interiors and numerous associated legends.
name: Arulmigu Chakrapani Swami Temple
address: X97F+92G, Chakrapani Sannathi Street, Karna Kollai Agraharam, Valayapettai Agraharam, Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu 612001, India

detail_description: The Kasi Viswanathar Temple in Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu is a historic Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. The main deity, Kasi Viswanathar, is worshipped within this 72 feet high temple alongside his consort Parvati as Visalakshi. This sacred site holds great importance and is mentioned in ancient texts like the Tevaram.
name: Kasi Viswanathar Temple
address: X94J+MV4, LBS Rd, Anna Nagar, Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu 612001, India

excerpt: Famous 12th-century Hindu temple featuring Dravidian architecture, ornate carvings & inscriptions.
detail_description: Dharasuram Sri Airavatesvara Temple is a renowned 12th-century Hindu temple located in the town of Darasuram near Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu. It is part of the Great Living Chola Temple trio and was built by Chola king Rajaraja Chola II. The temple features intricate carvings, inscriptions, and Dravidian architecture.
name: Airavatesvara Temple
address: Gurunathan Pillai Colony, Dharasuram, Kumbakonam, Valaiyapettai, Tamil Nadu 612702, India

detail_description: Located in Kumbakonam, the Sri Nageswaraswamy Temple is one of the town's oldest and most prominent Shiva temples. This early Chola temple is renowned for its exquisite sculptures and is believed to have been completed during the reign of Parantaka. According to legend, both Adisesha and Surya worshipped at this sacred site.
name: Sri Nageswaraswamy Temple
address: X95H+FFV, Nageswaran N St, Gandhi Adigal Salai, Valayapettai Agraharam, Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu 612001, India

excerpt: Kumbakonam, or Kudanthai, is a city municipal corporation in the Thanjavur district in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It is located 40 km from Thanjavur and 282 km from Chennai and is the headquarters of the Kumbakonam taluk of Thanjavur district. It is the second largest city in the district after Thanjavur. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Kumbakonam, also known as Kudanthai, is a charming temple town located in the Thanjavur district of Tamil Nadu, India. Situated between the Cauvery and Arsala rivers, it is renowned for its rich history and deep connections to Hindu culture. As the second largest city in the district after Thanjavur, Kumbakonam offers a plethora of tourist attractions and places to visit.
name: Kumbakonam
address: Tamil Nadu, India

detail_description: Arulmigu Ramaswamy Temple, located in Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu, India, is a Hindu sanctuary dedicated to Lord Rama. Constructed by the Nayakkar Kings, this ancient temple is renowned for its impressive architecture and intricate design. The three-layered Gopuram and surrounding serene atmosphere create a tranquil setting for prayer and contemplation. Inside the complex, visitors can admire stunning sculptures and murals depicting scenes from the epic Ramayana.
name: Ramaswamy Temple
address: No. 3 Ramaswamy Kovil Sanathi Street, East St, Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu 612001, India

name: Sri Kanchi Kamakoti Peetam Mutt, Kumbakonam Branch
address: 92, Mutt St, Swaminatha Nagar, Valayapettai Agraharam, Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu 612001, India

excerpt: Swamimalai is a panchayat town that is a suburb near Kumbakonam in Thanjavur District in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It lies on the banks of river Kaveri and is the site of the fourth of the six abodes of the Hindu deity Murugan. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Swamimalai, a panchayat town near Kumbakonam in Tamil Nadu, is situated on the banks of the river Kaveri and is home to the fourth of the six abodes of Murugan. Just 9.2 km away lies Papanasam village, known for its ancient temple dedicated to Papavinaseswarar, a form of Lord Shiva.
name: Swamimalai
address: Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu, India

excerpt: This Dravidian-style Hindu temple was built around the 2nd century BCE & features 3 gateway towers.
detail_description: Arulmigu Swaminatha Swamy Temple, also known as Swamimalai Murugan Temple, is a Dravidian-style Hindu temple located in Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu. Dating back to the 2nd century BCE, this temple is dedicated to Lord Murugan and is renowned for its three gateway towers.
name: Arulmigu Swaminatha Swamy Thirukoil, Swamimalai
address: 10, Vatampokki Street, Taluk, Swamimalai, Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu 612302, India

name: Arulmigu Vellai Pillaiyar Temple,Thiruvalanjuli
address: W8WH+328, Thiruvalanjuli, Kumbakonam, Thiruvalanjuli Thattimal, Tamil Nadu 612302, India

detail_description: The Srinivasa Ramanujan Monument, established by Sastra University and inaugurated by former President of India Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam, is a tribute to the renowned mathematician's lifetime achievements. The monument immortalizes the timeline of Srinivasa Ramanujan's contributions to mathematics, including number theory and continued fractions.
name: Srinivasa Ramanujan Monument
address: 612001, Karna Kollai Agraharam, Valayapettai Agraharam, Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu 612001, India

excerpt: 625 steps lead up a mountain to this Hindu temple & shrine offering worship services.
detail_description: Arulmigu Sri Oppiliappan Temple, also known as Thiruvinnagar of Venkatachalapathy, is a Hindu temple located near Thirunageswaram, just outside of Kumbakonam. The temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and follows the Dravidian style of architecture. It's the 60th Divya Desam among the 108 temples of Sri Vaishnavas.
name: Arulmigu Sri Oppiliappan Temple
address: 12, Oppiliyappan koil N St, Thirunageswaram, Tamil Nadu 612204, India

excerpt: Colourful Hindu temple dedicated to Surya featuring carved pillars & an ornate stepped tower.
detail_description: Suriyanar Koil Temple, also known as Suriyan Temple or Sun Temple, is a vibrant Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Surya. It stands out as one of the significant Navagraha temples and is renowned for its unique feature of not housing Lord Shiva. Instead, all the Navagraha deities are installed separately.
name: 1. Suriyanar Koil Temple- Suriyan Temple - Sun Temple
address: Thanjavur D.T, P.O, Thirumangalagudi, Tamil Nadu 612102, India

detail_description: Thirumanancheri Kalyana Sundareshwarar Temple, located near the tranquil Kaveri River in Nagapattinam district, is a place of great historical significance. The temple offers special poojas for those seeking marriage, which can be obtained at the ticket counter for a nominal fee of 150 rupees. Despite the bustling atmosphere, devotees can partake in the enriching experience of witnessing efficient pooja ceremonies conducted by knowledgeable pandits.
name: Thirumanancheri Kalyana Sundareshwarar Temple
address: Tirumananchery Temple, Thirumannancheri, Tamil Nadu 609801, India

excerpt: Patteeswaram is a village, eight kilometres from Kumbakonam in the state of Tamil Nadu in India. The village was named after Patti, the calf of Kamadhenu, the divine cow in Hindu mythology. It is the suburban region of Kumbakonam city in Thanjavur district. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Patteeswaram, a village located just eight kilometers from Kumbakonam in Tamil Nadu, India, is known for its connection to Hindu mythology and as a suburban region of Kumbakonam city. The village was named after Patti, the calf of Kamadhenu, the divine cow in Hindu mythology.
name: Patteeswaram
address: Tamil Nadu 612703, India

excerpt: Colourful Hindu temple devoted to Mahalinga featuring a pond & ornate stone carvings.
detail_description: Sri Mahalingaswami Kovil is a Hindu temple dedicated to Mahalinga, characterized by its vivid and vibrant colors. The structure features a pond and adorned with intricate and elaborate stonework carvings. This religious monument showcases ornate stone sculptures that enhance the aesthetic beauty of the temple's surroundings.
name: Sri Mahalingaswami Kovil
address: XFW2+3XG, SH 64, Thiruvidaimaruthur, Tamil Nadu 612104, India

excerpt: Colourful Hindu temple devoted to Mahalinga featuring a pond & ornate stone carvings.
detail_description: Sri Mahalingaswami Kovil, located in Thiruvidaimarudur, is a vibrant Hindu temple dedicated to Mahalinga. The temple is renowned for its ornate stone carvings and features a large pond. It is considered one of the greatest Shiva temples in Tamilnadu and is known for performing the Brahmahatya dosh parihar ritual.
name: Sri Mahalingaswami Kovil
address: XFW2+3XG, SH 64, Thiruvidaimaruthur, Tamil Nadu 612104, India
